== How are Mozilla applications translated upstream ==

* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.mozilla.org/L10n:Home_Page|Mozilla localization home page]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://l10n.mozilla.org/narro/narro_project_list.php|Narro]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.mozilla.org/Category:L10n_Teams|List of Mozilla localization teams]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://mxr.mozilla.org/l10n-central/source/|Translation files in the source tree]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://hg.mozilla.org/l10n-central|alternative view]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://l10n.mozilla.org/dashboard/|Mozilla applications - translation statistics]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://groups.google.com/group/mozilla.dev.l10n?lnk=srg|Localization mailing list]]</nowiki>
* IRC: #l10n @ irc.mozilla.org

There is no official way to translate Mozilla products, other than the fact that all translations must land in the <nowiki>[[http://hg.mozilla.org/l10n-central|Mercurial source tree]]</nowiki>. All teams use <nowiki>[[http://spreadsheets.google.com/ccc?key=pU-QuuJ-iK6boZ1GVPonsXw&hl=ca|different methods]]</nowiki>.

Some examples:

* Some teams work directly on the Mercurial repository, by translating with a normal text editor and committing them.
* Others convert the XPI files to PO with the <nowiki>[[http://translate.sourceforge.net/wiki/|Translate Toolkit]]</nowiki> tools and work on them with PO editors.
* Others use <nowiki>[[http://sourceforge.net/projects/moztrans/|Mozilla Translator]]</nowiki> for offline translation
* Others use <nowiki>[[https://l10n.mozilla.org/narro/narro_project_list.php|Narro]]</nowiki> for online translation, export the XPI files and manually commit them in Mercurial
